the_heights.name: The Heights
the_heights.description: Wealthy district built on the highest ground, featuring Victorian and Gothic-revival mansions, private gardens, and elite institutions. Completely dry with views overlooking the fog-shrouded city below.

notable_locations.name: Westwick City Hall
notable_locations.description: Imposing Gothic structure with clocktower, houses the surface government and bureaucracy

notable_locations.name: Luna Corp Headquarters
notable_locations.description: Modern glass and steel building with art deco elements, topped with a silver dome resembling the moon

notable_locations.name: The Lunarium Club
notable_locations.description: Exclusive social club for city elites, filled with lunar memorabilia and space race artifacts

notable_locations.name: St. Augustine's Cathedral
notable_locations.description: Neo-Gothic cathedral with flying buttresses and stained glass depicting both religious and lunar imagery

the_heights.social_elements: Old money families, corporate executives, government officials, and aerospace engineers
the_heights.noir_elements: Hidden corruption, blackmail, secret affairs, and corporate espionage

the_stilts.name: The Stilts
the_stilts.description: Newer district constructed after the flood on elevated platforms and stilts above the water. A mix of retrofuturistic design and practical engineering.

notable_locations.name: Elevated Transit Hub
notable_locations.description: Central node connecting tram lines that run between buildings above the flood waters

notable_locations.name: Blue Moon Research Facility
notable_locations.description: Luna Corp's visible research division, working on consumer applications of space technology

notable_locations.name: Skyway Apartments
notable_locations.description: Modern housing complex connected by bridges and elevated walkways

notable_locations.name: The Observatory Lounge
notable_locations.description: Upscale jazz club with glass walls and ceiling for lunar observation, popular with scientists and engineers

the_stilts.social_elements: Scientists, engineers, nouveau riche entrepreneurs, and forward-thinking professionals
the_stilts.noir_elements: Technological espionage, mysterious disappearances, and experimental technology gone wrong

harbor_town.name: Harbor Town
harbor_town.description: Working docks and warehouse district, mixture of dry docks and flooded berths. Busy with legitimate shipping and clandestine smuggling operations.

notable_locations.name: Westwick Harbor Authority
notable_locations.description: Administrative building controlling shipping, customs, and water traffic

notable_locations.name: The Rusty Anchor
notable_locations.description: Sailors' bar with reputation for rough clientele and valuable information exchange

notable_locations.name: Warehouse 13
notable_locations.description: Seemingly ordinary warehouse rumored to store recovered lunar artifacts

notable_locations.name: Fog Point Lighthouse
notable_locations.description: Historic lighthouse converted to use experimental lunar-powered beacon technology

harbor_town.social_elements: Dock workers, sailors, harbor police, smugglers, and customs officials
harbor_town.noir_elements: Smuggling operations, informants, dock-side murders, and mysterious cargo

the_shallows.name: The Shallows
the_shallows.description: Working-class residential area with permanent shallow flooding. Buildings have first floors abandoned or converted for water access, daily life occurs on second floors and above.

notable_locations.name: Westwick Central Market
notable_locations.description: Elevated marketplace with boats docking directly at stalls

notable_locations.name: St. Mary's of the Waters
notable_locations.description: Church with entrance now at second-floor level, lower level converted to boat dock

notable_locations.name: The Floating Record
notable_locations.description: Newspaper office and printing press, known for investigating flood-related stories

notable_locations.name: Canal Street Police Precinct
notable_locations.description: Modified police station with boat docks and raised entrances

the_shallows.social_elements: Factory workers, shopkeepers, police officers, reporters, and boat operators
the_shallows.noir_elements: Street-level corruption, protection rackets, and neighborhood tensions

drowntown.name: Drowntown
drowntown.description: Former financial district now partially submerged. Impressive stone buildings with only upper floors accessible. Lower floors have become underwater passages and hideouts.

notable_locations.name: The Exchange
notable_locations.description: Former stock exchange with trading floor now underwater, upper levels converted to offices

notable_locations.name: Westwick National Bank
notable_locations.description: Grand bank building with submerged vault rumored to contain unclaimed valuables

notable_locations.name: Hotel Neptune
notable_locations.description: Luxury hotel adapted to flooding with boat valets and water-level entrances

notable_locations.name: The Submerged Archive
notable_locations.description: City records office with many documents lost to flooding, controlled access to sensitive information

drowntown.social_elements: Financial workers, lawyers, black market dealers, and wealthy thrill-seekers
drowntown.noir_elements: Hidden underwater passages, forgotten evidence, and flooded crime scenes

the_depths.name: The Depths
the_depths.description: Completely flooded former neighborhood accessible only by boat or diving. Only rooftops and upper floors visible above water. Home to the most desperate and those hiding from society.

notable_locations.name: The Rooftop Colony
notable_locations.description: Makeshift settlement constructed on connected rooftops above water level

notable_locations.name: Cathedral of the Deep
notable_locations.description: Submerged church with only spire above water, rumored meeting place for 'The Submersibles' resistance

notable_locations.name: The Undertow
notable_locations.description: Bar accessible only by boat, built into the upper floor of a submerged apartment building

notable_locations.name: Salvage Central
notable_locations.description: Trading post for items recovered from flooded buildings, no questions asked about origin

the_depths.social_elements: Outcasts, scavengers, fugitives, and resistance members
the_depths.noir_elements: Perfect hiding places, forgotten evidence, bodies discovered in submerged buildings
